name: preception
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a belief or opinion formed before enough information is available to form it correctly: This programme challenges stereotypes and preceptions of the African continent.
More examplesFewer examplesAstonishing leaps of intuition lead to daring preceptions about the day-to-day lives of ancient citizens.There is a preception that war crime trials are yesterday's problem.The change in share price reflects the change in investors' preceptions about the growth of the company in the future.
